required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Uncommon Complications of Meckel's Diverticulum
clinical_study.official_title: The Uncommon Complications of Meckel's Diverticulum: a Single Center Case Series Study and Literature Review

brief_summary.textblock: Acas series study was conducted on emergency acute abdomen patients who finally confirmed intraoperatively as Meckel's diverticulum with different complications. Simple perforation to isolated axial torsioned gangrene was observed. The patients signed consent for their cases to be published.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was aimed at reporting the rare complications of Meckel's diverticulum, which were diagnosed intraoperatively among acute abdomen patients presented to HFCSH. The patients had different complications ranging from simple isolated perforation to gangrenous Meckel's diverticulum. All of the patients gave their informed written and signed consent for publication.

primary_outcome.description: outcome of patients with different complications were reported even though there was no death.

clinical_study.condition: To Report the Rare Occurrence of Meckel's Diverticulum

intervention.description: all patients were operated after being admitted to surgical ward for acute abdomen

study_pop.textblock: patients who presented with the diagnosis of acute abdomen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients diagnosed with complicated meckel's diverticulum
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who didn't consent

clinical_study.keyword: Meckel's diverticulum; isolated torsion; intussusception; acute abdomen; acute appendicitis

patient_data.ipd_description: Its against our institutions rule and regulations to share patient data to the third party
